posts.title: Kuensel A 29-year-old woman died on the night of November 19 after an alleged violent altercation...
posts.content: Kuensel A 29-year-old woman died on the night of November 19 after an alleged violent altercation with her 24-year-old partner in Thimphu. The incident occurred between 9.30 pm and 10 pm. Both individuals were reportedly under the influence of alcohol. According to sources, the couple had been living together for around six months. They are believed to have started arguing over a house key shortly before the confrontation turned violent. During the dispute, the woman is said to have pushed the man, after which he allegedly beat her severely and struck her head against a surface. The suspect later took her to the hospital, but she died en route. Police officials said the exact cause of death will be determined after a post-mortem examination. The suspect is in custody at the Thimphu Police Station.

posts.title: Kuensel Lyonchhen Tshering Tobgay departed for a three-day state visit to Bangladesh starting today
posts.content: Kuensel Lyonchhen Tshering Tobgay departed for a three-day state visit to Bangladesh starting today. The visit is at the invitation of the Chief Adviser of Bangladesh Dr. Muhammad Yunus. Lyonchhen is accompanied by the Minister for Foreign Affairs and External Trade Lyonpo D.N. Dhungyel, the Minister for Industry, Commerce and Employment Lyonpo Namgyal Dorji, and other officials from the Royal Government of Bhutan. During the visit, the Prime Minister will call on the President of Bangladesh and meet with the Chief Adviser, senior government officials, and members of the business community of Bangladesh. The Prime Minister will also interact with the Bhutanese community residing in Bangladesh.

posts.title: Kuensel Update: A 35-year-old man from Shingkhar in Zhemgang was referred to the Gelephu Central ...
posts.content: Kuensel Update: A 35-year-old man from Shingkhar in Zhemgang was referred to the Gelephu Central Regional Refferal Hospital yesterday after a tiger attack around 9am along the Changkhar farm road in the gewog. The incident occurred when the victim and another man went into the bushes below the road to relieve themselves. They were among villagers working on the farm-road base course for blacktopping. The patient is currently in stable condition and admitted to the surgical ward to undergo a minor surgery. The patient sustained multiple bite and puncture wounds on the right arm and leg, small cuts on the scalp, a fractured bone in his right wrist, and suspected injuries to the ligaments and meniscus of his right knee. The tiger was initially spotted while they were on their way to the worksite and was chased away by pelting stones. This is the first human-tiger conflict in the gewog, although the three tigers roaming the villages have reportedly killed 20 to 30 cattle each year, according to local leaders.

posts.title: Update: Residents of Goenshari Gewog gathered for an awareness meeting on Economic Stimulus Plan ...
posts.content: Update: Residents of Goenshari Gewog gathered for an awareness meeting on Economic Stimulus Plan (ESP) loans, marking the ninth gewog covered in Punakha. With only Kabesa Gewog left, Goenshari is the second last gewog in the dzongkhag to receive this outreach. Kabesa Gup, Sonam Dorji, who serves at the Thrizin has voluntarily taken the initiative to travel across villages to help residents better understand the ESP loan process and benefits. So far, more than 200 people in Punakha are reported to have applied for ESP loans. #Kuensel #news #Update #Bhutan #ESP

posts.title: Kuensel        The sublime Kalachakra Sand Mandala was reverently dismantled this afternoon by Hi...
posts.content: Kuensel        The sublime Kalachakra Sand Mandala was reverently dismantled this afternoon by His Eminence Dorji Lopen Rinpoche, assisted by Lop Lhabgay, at the sacralized Changlimithang ground. The sacred rite was performed with profound liturgical proceedings and solemn ceremonial observances, after which the blessed sand was respectfully dispersed into the Thimphu River as part of the traditional purification offering. The auspicious occasion was graced by His Excellency the Prime Minister, Cabinet Ministers, senior government officials, esteemed Khenpos, and the venerable Sangha community. The dismantling of the sacred Kalachakra Sand Mandala embodies the profound Buddhist teaching on impermanence, that all conditioned phenomena arise, abide for a moment, and ultimately dissolve. +24

posts.title: Kuensel Their Majesties The King and Gyaltsuen, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, and the Royal...
posts.content: Kuensel Their Majesties The King and Gyaltsuen, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, and the Royal Family graced the inauguration of the Kalachakra at Changlimithang today, together with His Excellency Prime Minister of India Shri Narendra Modi. His Majesty The King, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, and Prime Minister Modi inaugurated the Kalachakra ‘Wheel of Time’ Initiation and Empowerment, which is presided over by His Holiness the Je Khenpo. The Kalachakra empowerment is among the most profound teachings in Vajrayana Buddhism. Thousands of people attended the empowerment, which will continue till November 14th. Later, His Majesty The King personally saw off Prime Minister Modi at Paro Airport. Prime Minister Modi was on a two-day visit to Bhutan on the occasion of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo’s 70th Birth Anniversary. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck +25

posts.title: Kuensel 11 November 2025 Bhutan celebrated the 70th Birth Anniversary of His Majesty the Fourth D...
posts.content: Kuensel 11 November 2025 Bhutan celebrated the 70th Birth Anniversary of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, which coincided this year with the holy Labab Duechen (Descending Day of Lord Buddha). His Majesty The King Addressed the Nation from Changlimithang, offering tribute and expressing the gratitude and love of the people of Bhutan for His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo. The celebrations were a coming together of all of Bhutan - His Majesty and the Royal Family, the government, and over 27,000 people filling the stands, many of whom came to the stadium as early as last evening. Foreign Guests, including Ambassadors and heads of international organizations, as well as Buddhist Masters from around the world, who are in Bhutan for the Global Peace Prayer Festival, joined the celebrations. +24

posts.title: Kuensel Public Notification The Royal Government is pleased to declare a special National holiday...
posts.content: Kuensel Public Notification The Royal Government is pleased to declare a special National holiday on November 12th, 13th and 14th in honour of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo’s 70th Birth Anniversary and the sacred Kalachakra Empowerment segment of the ongoing Global Peace Prayer Festival in Changlimithang. This rare and profound spiritual empowerment, one of a kind in its depth and significance, offers a precious opportunity for all Bhutanese to immerse themselves in prayers, reflection and collective aspiration for His Majesty The Fourth King's long life and for global peace. The empowerment will be broadcast live on television and online platforms, allowing Bhutanese far and wide, as well as people from around the world, to participate through prayer, contemplation, and gratitude. While the holiday will be observed throughout the country, critical and essential services shall continue to operate to ensure uninterrupted public service.

They also met the Dorji Lopen of the Central Monastic Body, who is presiding over the sacred Jabzhi Ritual. Source: Zhung Dratshang #kuensel #update #globalpeaceprayerfestival #peaceprayer +2

posts.title: Kuensel 8 November 2025 - An unprecedented number of people attended the Global Peace Prayer Fest...
posts.content: Kuensel 8 November 2025 - An unprecedented number of people attended the Global Peace Prayer Festival today, with estimates of over 85,000 people in and around the venue. People began arriving in Changlimithang as early as midnight, and by the time prayers began, the football stadium, as well as the Centenary Park were filled with devotees. The Royal Family have graced the festival since the start of the festival on November 4th. Today, His Majesty The King, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen, and Members of the Royal Family were present for the prayers. This is the largest non-sectarian Vajrayana Buddhist Global Peace Prayer, representing all sects of Vajrayana Buddhism as well as other vehicles of Buddhism. Today’s prayers were led by the masters of the Nyingma Choedey of Bhutan. Meanwhile, the Central Monastic Body is conducting Jabzhi Dhoechog at Kuenselphodrang as a part of the Global Peace Prayer Festival, dedicated to global peace and happiness. The Global Peace Prayer concludes on November 10th, following which the Kalachakra empowerment by His Holiness the Je Khenpo will be held from 12-14 November. +72

posts.title: Kuensel Press Release: Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of India will be on a two-day State Visit to...
posts.content: Kuensel Press Release: Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of India will be on a two-day State Visit to Bhutan coinciding with the 70th Birth Anniversary of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo from 11-12 November 2025. During the visit, Prime Minister Modi will join the people of Bhutan in celebrating the 70th Birth Anniversary of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo in Changlimithang on 11 November 2025. The visit by Prime Minister Modi is a testimony of the extraordinary warmth, trust and mutual respect between the monarchs of Bhutan and Indian leaders across generations and has been the cornerstone of Bhutan–India relations. The State Visit to Bhutan by Prime Minister Modi coincides with the exposition of the Sacred Relics of Lord Buddha from India. Prime Minister Modi will also participate in the Global Peace Prayer Festival in Thimphu. Bhutan and India

posts.title: Kuensel Just In: The Sacred Relics of Lord Buddha, presently enshrined at the National Museum in ...
posts.content: Kuensel Just In: The Sacred Relics of Lord Buddha, presently enshrined at the National Museum in New Delhi, will be brought to Bhutan from 08 to 18 November 2025, with the gracious support of the Government of India. The Sacred Relics will be enshrined at the Grand Kuenray of Tashichhodzong on public display from 12 to 17 November 2025, in commemoration of the 70th Birth Anniversary of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo. This auspicious occasion will enable the people of Bhutan to offer veneration, receive blessings, and participate in the Global Peace Prayer Festival. The relics known as the Piprahwa-Kapilavastu Relics hold profound historical and spiritual significance. Regarded as among the most venerated objects in the global Buddhist tradition, they provide a direct and tangible link to Lord Buddha’s physical presence and enduring blessings. The Sacred Relics will be escorted by a high-level delegation from the Government of India, comprising senior officials from the Ministry of Culture, the National Museum of India, and the International Buddhist Confederation.

posts.title: Kuensel 4th November 2025: His Majesty the King, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, Her Majesty ...
posts.content: Kuensel 4th November 2025: His Majesty the King, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, Her Majesty the Gyaltsuen, and members of the Royal Family graced the opening of the Global Peace Prayer at Thimphu Changlimithang today. His Holiness the Je Khenpo presided over the opening prayers, as an unprecedented number of devotees, many arriving as early as 3 am, gathered for Bhutan’s first assembly of eminent global Buddhist leaders at this scale. The main prayer ground reached capacity, with the crowd overflowing into the adjoining football stadium. People from all parts of the country have gathered in Thimphu for the prayers, along with many visitors from abroad, representing nearly every sect and tradition of Buddhism. As a deeply Buddhist country, this breadth of participation holds special significance for Bhutan. Simultaneous prayers are being held at Kuenselphodrang, where the Central Monastic Body has commenced the Jabshi Gyap rituals for peace and well-being. The Global Peace Prayer unites Buddhist leaders and devotees in aspiration prayers for global peace and happiness, and is hosted by the Royal Government of Bhutan in partnership with the Central Monastic Body. +65

posts.title: The Passing Out Parade (POP) for the Second Cohort of the 2025 batch of Gyalsung was held today, ...
posts.content: The Passing Out Parade (POP) for the Second Cohort of the 2025 batch of Gyalsung was held today, with simultaneous ceremonies taking place at the four Gyalsung Academies in Pemathang, Gyalpozhing, Khotokha, and Jamtsholing. His Majesty The King addressed the 1992 Gyalsups across the four Gyalsung Academies from Thimphu. His Majesty congratulated the Gyalsups and their families who were there to support them and celebrate with them, and said that this was a proud and emotional moment for everyone. His Majesty said that the purpose of Gyalsung is to build strong foundations for the future. Our success as a nation will be by and for the people of Bhutan, and Gyalsung will strengthen generations of Bhutanese. His Majesty then outlined three keys that would unlock Bhutan’s success as a nation — the hive strategy, which encourages collective strength and collaboration; building a trust economy, where integrity and reliability are the foundation of national prosperity; and leveraging our small size to be agile, enabling Bhutan to adapt swiftly and effectively in an ever-changing world. His Royal Highness Gyaltsab Jigme Dorji Wangchuck, His Excellency Prime Minister Dasho Tshering Tobgay, the Chief Operations Officer of the Royal Bhutan Army Lieutenant General Batoo Tshering, and the Chairperson of the Privy Council Lyonpo (Dr.) Tandin Dorji presided over the Passing Out Parade ceremonies at Gyalpozhing, Jamtsholing, Khotokha, and Pemathang respectively.
posts.author: Kuensel

posts.title: Kuensel India’s Union Finance Minister on four-day official visit to Bhutan Union Minister for Fi...
posts.content: Kuensel India’s Union Finance Minister on four-day official visit to Bhutan Union Minister for Finance and Corporate Affairs, Nirmala Sitharaman, began a four-day official visit to Bhutan today, aimed at strengthening bilateral economic and development cooperation. Her visit will start with a tour of the historic Sangchen Choekhor Monastery, established in 1765 and home to more than 100 monks studying advanced Buddhist philosophy. During her stay, the Minister will visit several major projects funded by the Government of India, including the Kurichhu Hydropower Plant, Gyalsung Academy, Sangchen Choekhor Monastery and Punakha Dzong. The Minsiter is scheduled to call on His Majesty the King and Prime Minister Dasho Tshering Tobgay. She will also meet Finance Minister Lekey Dorji to discuss ways to expand economic and financial cooperation. She will receive briefings on Bhutan’s energy sector from Druk Green Power Corporation, the 21st Century Economic Roadmap, the banking and financial sector from Druk PNB and Bank of Bhutan, and the Gelephu Mindfulness City project. The Minister will also visit the Cottage and Small Industries Market, where she will witness a transaction using India’s Unified Payments Interface, reflecting the growing digital and financial connectivity between the two nations. On the final leg of her visit, she will travel to Punakha Dzong, and will meet farmers along the route to learn about local agricultural practices and challenges. posts.title: Kuensel October 29, 2025: His Majesty The King and Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen are in Thailand to p...
posts.content: Kuensel October 29, 2025: His Majesty The King and Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen are in Thailand to pay respects to Her Late Majesty Queen Sirikit, The Queen Mother of Thailand, and to convey personal condolences to His Majesty The King of Thailand. Their Majesties offered a wreath and signed the book of condolences before the Royal Urn at the Dusit Maha Prasat Throne Hall in the Grand Palace. Later in the evening, Their Majesties joined His Majesty The King and Members of the Royal Family of Thailand for the royal merit-making and prayer ceremony for the late Queen Mother. Her Majesty Queen Sirikit passed away on 24 October 2025 at the age of 93. The Kingdom of Thailand is observing a period of national mourning to honour Her Majesty, whose lifetime of service and compassion earned her the deep love and reverence of the Thai people. Their Majesties’ presence in Bangkok reflects the close friendship between the Royal Families of Bhutan and Thailand, and the enduring bonds of respect and goodwill between the two nations. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck +8

posts.title: Kuensel Kathok Situ Rinpoche presided over the groundbreaking ceremony (Salhang Tendrel) for the ...
posts.content: Kuensel Kathok Situ Rinpoche presided over the groundbreaking ceremony (Salhang Tendrel) for the Barchey Kuensel Choeten in Gelephu Mindfulness City (GMC) today. The 61-meter-tall Choeten, encircled by 108 smaller stupas, will be constructed on 21 acres of land at Samtengang in Samtenling Gewog, overlooking the entire airport area. The construction of the main Chorten, which will begin next year, is planned to be completed by 2029, coinciding with the completion of the Gelephu International Airport. The project, proposed by Khenpo Karma Wangchuk, is one of 14 spiritual projects, including two Royal projects, endorsed by His Majesty the King this year. These projects form the spiritual foundation of GMC, which positions it as a global hub for mindfulness and spiritual exploration. Rinpoche was received by GMC Governor Dasho Dr Lotay Tshering, Dasho Tashi Dorji, Head of Spiritual Affairs for GMC, and other GMC officials. +7

posts.title: Kuensel 23 October 2025: This year’s edition of the Royal Highland Festival was all the more spec...
posts.content: Kuensel 23 October 2025: This year’s edition of the Royal Highland Festival was all the more special with the presence of Their Majesties The King and Gyaltsuen, and Their Royal Highnesses Gyalsey Jigme Namgyel, Gyalsey Ugyen Wangchuck, and Gyalsem Sonam Yangden Wangchuck. The Royal Highland Festival was initiated in 2016 upon Royal Command, to promote highland culture, support livelihoods of the highland peoples. His Majesty has graced the festival each year, and in the more recent years accompanied by His Royal Highness Gyalsey Jigme Namgyel. The two-day festival was attended by the Prime Minister and senior officials, local leaders, the people of Laya and other highland communities, and a mix of local and international visitors. Rows of yak-hair tents framed the festival grounds at Langothang, where the programme featured traditional song and dance, games, animal shows, and the annual Laya Run — a highly competitive 25K race to the venue. Visitors, who stay in homestays in the picturesque village of Laya for the duration of the festival, sampled highland food and browsed local products. His Majesty The King granted Royal Tokha. The Royal Highland Festival has grown steadily in popularity since its inception, with an increasing number of domestic tourists, especially young visitors, attending alongside international tourists. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck +38

posts.title: Today, three new spiritual projects have been officially approved by His Majesty The King, Chairm...
posts.content: Today, three new spiritual projects have been officially approved by His Majesty The King, Chairman of the Board of Directors of GMC. These projects are in addition to the eight that were approved earlier this year. The Royal Kashos (Royal edicts) were formally handed over by Secretary of Dratshang Lhentshog, Dasho Zangla Namgyel. The ceremony took place today at Changangkha Lhakhang and was attended by members of the GMC team. The three newly approved projects are: - Druk Ugyen Samye Ling – Under the patronage of Namkhai Nyingpo Rinpoche, this project will strengthen the Buddha Dharma in keeping with Bhutan’s rich spiritual heritage. - Gelephu Maitreya Temple – Led by Trulku Kunga Tenzin, this temple will serve as a spiritual landmark dedicated to Maitreya Buddha. - Tara Retreat Center – Established by Bhutan Tara Foundation under the patronage of Leytshog Lopen Sangay Dorji of the Central Monastic Body, this center will provide a dedicated space for Tara practice and retreats. These join eight projects approved in May. With two Royal Projects and a project by the Central Monastic Body, GMC now has 14 sacred sites in development, including a Buddhist University and retreat centers. "As more of these approved projects get underway, we're very encouraged to see GMC's spiritual vision already taking shape,"

posts.title: Kuensel Just in—Jaigaon Police have recovered Nu 200,000 belonging to two Bhutanese farmers from ...
posts.content: Kuensel Just in—Jaigaon Police have recovered Nu 200,000 belonging to two Bhutanese farmers from Tading, Samtse, who were duped in a currency exchange scam across the border. The money was handed over to the victims today. The incident occurred on Monday when the victims were lured by individuals claiming to exchange ngultrum for US dollars at a favorable rate. Acting on the suspects’ directions, the two travelled from Phuentsholing to the Barobisa toll plaza, boarding a Nganglam-bound bus. Upon meeting the suspects, they were led into a forest on foot for about 15 to 20 kilometres, where their money and belongings were reportedly robbed. The victims later reached Jaigaon and filed a complaint at the local police station. Four individuals are suspected to be involved in the case. “We have got the money back and are thankful to Jaigaon Police IC Paljor Bhutia for helping us from the beginning,” one of the victims said. The victims, who had planned to travel abroad soon, said they were fortunate to have escaped unharmed and urged others to be cautious against similar scams.

posts.title: Kuensel October 8, 2025: As the third group of volunteers begin their work in Gelephu Mindfulness...
posts.content: Kuensel October 8, 2025: As the third group of volunteers begin their work in Gelephu Mindfulness City (GMC) His Majesty The King announced the launch of Pelsung. Pelsung, meaning Guardians of Prosperity, is a new national initiative to engage Bhutanese youth in developing creative and practical solutions for the GMC. His Majesty announced Pelsung as the third pillar of nation-building alongside Desuung and Gyalsung, instituted to help build strong foundations for the country’s future. “For a small population, every single person matters, and these programmes are intended to empower our people, to build harmony and the capacity to work together. As His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo said in the 1974 Coronation Address, our collective efforts will have far greater impact than the concerted efforts of a few,” His Majesty said. His Majesty said that the Gelephu Mindfulness City represents the aspirations of the nation taking shape, and that the sacred responsibility to protect Bhutan’s unity, harmony, and unique identity for all time falls on the youth. “Everything we are doing today is for our youth – so that they will be better versions of us, better prepared, smarter, and more hard-working. It falls on us to build that future, and on them to protect it and take it to greater heights,” His Majesty said. “That is the reason Pelsung has been created. I invite larger and larger numbers — the brightest and strongest amongst us — to join. We begin with 300–400 Pelsups, but expect to have thousands in the coming years. While today we bring in experts to help build the GMC, it is imperative that Bhutanese are able to take over the responsibility and become its custodians.” “My father entrusted the responsibility of Kingship to me when I was only 26, with enormous confidence and even greater expectations. I would

posts.title: Kuensel Thousands of volunteers from across the country are taking part in the third phase of the...
posts.content: Kuensel Thousands of volunteers from across the country are taking part in the third phase of the voluntary service in the Gelephu Mindfulness City (GMC). His Majesty the King graced the inauguration, along with the launch of the Innovate for GMC initiative. The former Yangbi Lopen of Zhung Dratshang, 98-year-old Baso Karp from Haa, is among 8,042 volunteers from Thimphu, Haa, Paro, Punakha and Mongar, along with trainees and locals from Sarpang, taking part in the third phase. For five days, starting today, citizens from all walks of life, including farmers, civil servants, monks, nuns, armed forces, Desuups, Gyalsuups, and parliamentarians, will set aside their daily routines to take up sickles and spades for bush clearance and the development of park areas and soft landscaping. +6

posts.title: October 6, 2025: Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen graced the inaugural session of the Third Annual PEMA ...
posts.content: October 6, 2025: Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen graced the inaugural session of the Third Annual PEMA Symposium at Zhichenkhar, Thimphu, this morning. Mental health experts and advocates from Bhutan and across the world have gathered in Thimphu for the three-day symposium, being held under the theme “Empowering Young Minds, Building Futures: Investing in Children and Adolescents’ Mental Health and Well-Being.” Addressing the Symposium, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen spoke about our collective responsibility to nurture the wellbeing of our children. “No matter how much progress we make in education, health, or development, we cannot flourish as a society if our children do not feel safe, supported, and able to grow with confidence and joy,” Her Majesty said. Outlining important progress made since the establishment of the PEMA Secretariat three years ago, Her Majesty said that this was only the beginning. “Our children deserve a system that not only responds to harm but also actively promotes well-being, nurtures resilience, and prevents harm before it occurs. They deserve homes and schools where they feel safe, loved, and supported; communities that hear their voices and empower them to thrive; and services that are sensitive to their needs,” Her Majesty said. Her Majesty said that our Kings have always guided us through visionary policies, such as Gross National Happiness placing well-being and happiness as a measure of progress, and DeSuung, Gyalsung, and now GMC as avenues for young people to gain discipline, skills, purpose, and opportunities. The Prime Minister, Ministers, senior government officials, and representatives from stakeholder agencies, international organizations, civil society, and education institutions were part of the event. The Annual PEMA Symposium, initiated under the leadership of Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen, serves as a national platform to strengthen collaboration and advance mental health and well-being in Bhutan. This year’s symposium focuses on promoting the mental health of children and adolescents and strengthening systems within the health, education, and social sectors. The inaugural session also saw the launch of the National Mental Health Strategy and the Bhutan Reintegration and Value Enhancement (BRAVE) Programme, key initiatives to strengthen coordinated national action for mental health and well-being.

posts.title: Kuensel October 6, 2025: Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen graced the inaugural session of the Third Annu...
posts.content: Kuensel October 6, 2025: Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen graced the inaugural session of the Third Annual PEMA Symposium at Zhichenkhar, Thimphu, this morning. Mental health experts and advocates from Bhutan and across the world have gathered in Thimphu for the three-day symposium, being held under the theme “Empowering Young Minds, Building Futures: Investing in Children and Adolescents’ Mental Health and Well-Being.” Addressing the Symposium, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen spoke about our collective responsibility to nurture the wellbeing of our children. “No matter how much progress we make in education, health, or development, we cannot flourish as a society if our children do not feel safe, supported, and able to grow with confidence and joy,” Her Majesty said. Outlining important progress made since the establishment of the PEMA Secretariat three years ago, Her Majesty said that this was only the beginning. “Our children deserve a system that not only responds to harm but also actively promotes well-being, nurtures resilience, and prevents harm before it occurs. They deserve homes and schools where they feel safe, loved, and supported; communities that hear their voices and empower them to thrive; and services that are sensitive to their needs,” Her Majesty said. Her Majesty said that our Kings have always guided us through visionary policies, such as Gross National Happiness placing well-being and happiness as a measure of progress, and DeSuung, Gyalsung, and now GMC as avenues for young people to gain discipline, skills, purpose, and opportunities. The Prime Minister, Ministers, senior government officials, and representatives from stakeholder agencies, international organizations, civil society, and education institutions were part of the event. The Annual PEMA Symposium, initiated under the leadership of Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen, serves as a national platform to strengthen collaboration and advance mental health and well-being in Bhutan. This year’s symposium focuses on promoting the mental health of children and adolescents and strengthening systems within the health, education, and social sectors. The inaugural session also saw the launch of the National Mental Health Strategy and the Bhutan Reintegration and Value Enhancement (BRAVE) Programme, key initiatives to strengthen coordinated national action for mental health and well-being. +2

posts.title: Kuensel Gangtey Trulku Kunzang Rigdzin Pema Namgyal Rinpoche visited Pemaling in Serzhong on Octo...
posts.content: Kuensel Gangtey Trulku Kunzang Rigdzin Pema Namgyal Rinpoche visited Pemaling in Serzhong on October 3 to inspect the proposed site for the Kurkulee Centre under the Gelephu Mindfulness City (GMC). The GMC Governor, Dasho Dr Lotay Tshering, received Rinpoche, who was accompanied by the Kurkulee Centre Committee. The Centre, initiated by Gangtey Trulku Rinpoche, is one of eight spiritual projects approved by His Majesty the King in May this year, forming the spiritual foundation of the GMC and establishing it as a global hub for mindfulness and spiritual exploration. The project is envisioned as an iconic monument within the GMC that will embody sacred mandala geometry and enshrine the Kurkulee Tara statue. The main temple is expected to be completed within five years. Covering over 25 acres, Kurkulee Centre features the main temple, accommodation for monks and devotees, Dharma Centre/Chhoekhang, Healing Centre, Retreat Centre, Healing Garden, amphitheatre, sustainable organic farming, admin building, circulation/road network, open spaces, and parking facilities. Rinpoche expressed his deep gratitude to His Majesty the King for granting him and his Choetsog the sacred opportunity to participate in this noble national undertaking. During this auspicious occasion, prayers and aspirations were offered for the successful progress and swift completion of the Kurkulee Centre — a sacred project envisioned to fulfil His Majesty’s noble vision for the spiritual and social well-being of the people, according to the project office. To oversee the planning and execution of the project, the Kurkulee Centre Project Head Office was officially inaugurated on September 19, corresponding to the 28th day of the seventh month of the Female Wood Snake Year. Photos: Kurkulee Centre +5

posts.content: Kuensel Editorial:  ,     The Anti-Corruption Commission’s (ACC) recent investigation into the Paro Dzongkhag engineering cell has once again revealed how entrenched and systemic corruption can be when oversight is weak and personal interests override public duty. The case, implicating 27 individuals, including six public officials and 21 contractors, uncovered fraudulent bidding, bribery, and abuse of power in no fewer than 17 projects over six years. For a country that prides on being among the least corrupt in South Asia, the scale of collusion in this case is alarming. https://kuenselonline.com/.../fighting-corruption-both... #ACC #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: Kuensel Update: After arriving in New York for the UNGA High-Level Week, the Prime Minister began...
posts.content: Kuensel Update: After arriving in New York for the UNGA High-Level Week, the Prime Minister began his engagements with a meeting with Anna Bjerde, Managing Director of Operations at the World Bank. Their discussions focused on the status of ongoing projects and explored opportunities to deepen collaboration beyond the existing partnership framework. In the afternoon, the Prime Minister attended the P3 (Public-Private Partnerships) Summit, an exclusive gathering of global leaders and CEOs designed to align government priorities with private sector investments. In his address, the Prime Minister spoke on the opportunities for investment in the Gelephu Mindfulness City (GMC), emphasizing that under His Majesty’s leadership, the GMC represents a government that is business-ready. Later in the evening, the Prime Minister traveled to Washington D.C., where he is scheduled to meet senior U.S. officials and representatives from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce to discuss bilateral cooperation and explore opportunities for business and investment. Source: PMoB
posts.author: Kuensel

posts.title: Kuensel           Bhutan was honored with the Best Leading Heritage Destination award at the Sout...
posts.content: Kuensel           Bhutan was honored with the Best Leading Heritage Destination award at the South Asian Travel Awards 2025 in Colombo, where over 1,500 participants from Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, and Sri Lanka gathered to celebrate excellence in travel and hospitality. The Hotel and Restaurant Association of Bhutan (HRAB) received this prestigious award on behalf of the country, highlighting Bhutan’s commitment to preserving its cultural heritage. Among other Bhutanese winners, Zhiwaling Heritage received two awards—a Gold for Heritage Hotel and a Silver for Leading Eco-Friendly Resort. Le Méridien Paro Riverfront secured Gold in its category, while Druk Hotel and Darlha Hotel were recognized as leading city hotels above and below 40 rooms, respectively. Terma Linca Resort won two awards in Leading Spa & Wellness and conference & meeting Mr. Khagendra Dahal from Hotel Tashi YiD Wong Grand Hotel received the Best General Manager award. SATA appointed Kuenzang Thinley, Vice Chairman of HRAB, as SATA Bhutan Chapter Chairman. He will promote SATA’s vision, engage with local tourism stakeholders, encourage nominations, and serve as the official media spokesperson in Bhutan. This achievement highlights Bhutan’s growing prominence in South Asia’s travel industry. #Bhutan #heritage #AwardWinning #Kuensel +2

posts.title: Kuensel Actress Tandin Bidha won the Yakushi Pearl Award for her performance in "I, the Song" at ...
posts.content: Kuensel Actress Tandin Bidha won the Yakushi Pearl Award for her performance in "I, the Song" at the Osaka Asian Film Festival in Japan today. The award recognizes the most brilliant performers among all participating films cast members. "I, the Song" was selected in the competition category of this years Osaka Asian Film Festival. This is the second international award won by "I, the Song". The director of the film, Dechen Roder, won the Best Director Award for the film at the 28th Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival 2024 in Estonia, competing in the Critics' Picks Competition. The film is also the winner of multiple national awards at the Bhutan National Film Awards 2025, including Best Film. 0:00 / 2:01

posts.title: Kuensel 4 September 2025: His Majesty The King joined 7,050 volunteers contributing zhabtog (comm...
posts.content: Kuensel 4 September 2025: His Majesty The King joined 7,050 volunteers contributing zhabtog (community service) to develop public spaces and parks across Gelephu Mindfulness City A total of 7,050 volunteers are taking part in the program, including residents of Gelephu and nearby areas, Gyalsups and Desuups. Volunteers from outside Gelephu include Members of Parliament, various agencies, DHI and its companies, Bhutan Red Cross, Judiciary, NGOs, and community groups from Tsirang, Dagana, Pemathang, Phuentsholing, Trong, Mendrelgang, and Nganglam. The mass volunteer program, being held from 4-8 September, was developed following overwhelming interest from people across the country to participate in building GMC. They will work under expert coordinators to clean and clear areas identified for parks, install benches, water points and toilets, and beautify various parts of the GMC. His Majesty thanked the volunteers for their service in helping to build GMC, which represents the collective aspiration of the people of Bhutan to create a lasting legacy that will benefit generations into the future. +4

posts.title: Kuensel Editorial:     ’ For years, cleaning campaigns in Bhutan have been little more than a ritual
posts.content: Kuensel Editorial:     ’ For years, cleaning campaigns in Bhutan have been little more than a ritual. People came together with gloves and sacks, streets looked tidy for a day or two, and social media brimmed with photos of civic duty. But soon enough, drains filled again, footpaths grew ugly with doma stains, and bridges became dumping sites. The message “do not litter in the first place” was repeated endlessly, but it rarely stuck. Conscience, it seems, was not enough. https://kuenselonline.com/.../cameras-catch-what... #editorial #Bhutan
posts.author: Kuensel

posts.title: Editorial:        Anaemia is not a distant health statistic
posts.content: Editorial:        Anaemia is not a distant health statistic. It is one of the most pressing health problems in the country today, and it is silently weakening the foundation of our society. Nearly half of Bhutanese children under the age of five suffer from anaemia. A third of our adolescents and pregnant women are affected as well. These numbers are more than just figures on a health report—they represent children who are too tired to focus in school, mothers facing dangerous pregnancies, and families coping with the weight of poor health. If left unchecked, anaemia will undermine our human capital, our ability to learn, work, and build a stronger nation. https://kuenselonline.com/.../nation-cannot-thrive-on... #anaemia #editorial #Bhutan

Stronger taxes on harmful products is not just a revenue measure, it is an act of national self-preservation. https://kuenselonline.com/news/taxing-harm-to-save-lives #NCDs #taxing #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: His Royal Highness Prince Jigyel Ugyen Wangchuck, son of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo Jigme...
posts.content: His Royal Highness Prince Jigyel Ugyen Wangchuck, son of His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo Jigme Singye Wangchuck and Her Majesty the Queen Mother Ashi Dorji Wangmo Wangchuck, was today joined in marriage with Ugen Choden Namgyel, daughter of Mr. Singye Namgyel and Mrs. Tshering Lhamo. The Royal Wedding was held at Dechencholing Palace in Thimphu on 25 August 2025. The Royal Couple received the sacred blessings of His Majesty The King, His Majesty the Fourth Druk Gyalpo, and His Holiness the Je Khenpo. His Royal Highness is a graduate of St Peter’s College, University of Oxford, where he earned his degree, and holds an Executive MBA from INSEAD. His Royal Highness serves the Kingdom with distinction as President of the Bhutan Olympic Committee since 2009, Vice President of the Olympic Council of Asia, and a Member of the International Olympic Committee. His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck
posts.author: Kuensel

posts.title: Update: The stretch of road along the Phuentsholing–Samtse highway at Amochu, in front of STCBL, ...
posts.content: Update: The stretch of road along the Phuentsholing–Samtse highway at Amochu, in front of STCBL, has been in poor condition for months, causing problems for commuters. Light vehicles often get stuck or sustain damage on the potholes, forcing drivers to slow down or stop. Commuters say the issue occurs daily, and even when repairs are carried out, the patches are washed away the next day by rain and traffic. Drivers are suggesting that they be allowed to use alternative lane for their safety and convenience. #Bhutan #Kuensel #news #UpdateNews #phuentsholing #amochhu #roadsafety
posts.author: Kuensel

posts.title: Editorial:      ? The government has discontinued the tourist airfare subsidy after six months, foll
posts.content: Editorial:      ? The government has discontinued the tourist airfare subsidy after six months, following the recommendation made by the Economic and Finance Committee of the National Assembly. The scheme, launched in November 2024, promised to boost arrivals during off-season months. The government had allocated Nu 49.5 million for the subsidy, of which Nu 38.59 million was utilised. A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period. https://kuenselonline.com/.../was-the-airfare-subsidy... #tourism #DoT #TCB #Bhutan
